attributes.action: Make Year 10 & 12 students the first to go back instead of Primary Schools
attributes.additional_details: During Boris’ speech, he gave details that primary school would return first, and this makes sense in part. However, I speak for many students across the country who would prefer year 10 and 12 to return first, as this is our final years and is crucial for our future. If you also return primary school first, it will be extremely hard to monitor their health and hygiene (they constantly touch surfaces and each other). Yet, older students understand this, therefore we will take safer precautions.
attributes.background: We want you to reconsider your option of returning primary school students first, instead returning Year 10 & 12, who have crucial exams next year that will affect their future lives permanently. They are also more aware of how to stay safe from getting Corona, consequently less spread will occur.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320531

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
